verses.verse: <S%G1161><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> looking <S%G816><s%> steadfastly at the council, <S%G4892><s%> said, <S%G2036><s%> <S%G435><s%> "Brothers, <S%G80><s%> I <S%G1473><s%> have lived <S%G4176><s%> before God <S%G2316><s%> in all <S%G3956><s%> good <S%G18><s%> conscience <S%G4893><s%> until <S%G891><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> day. <S%G2250><s%>"

The <S%G1161><s%> high priest, <S%G749><s%> Ananias, <S%G367><s%> commanded <S%G2004><s%> those who <S%G3588><s%> stood by <S%G3936><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to strike <S%G5180><s%> him <S%G846><s%> on the mouth. <S%G4750><s%>

Then <S%G5119><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> him, <S%G846><s%> "God <S%G2316><s%> will <S%G3195><s%> strike <S%G5180><s%> you, <S%G4571><s%> you whitewashed <S%G2867><s%> wall! <S%G5109><s%> <S%G2532><s%> Do you <S%G4771><s%> sit <S%G2521><s%> to judge <S%G2919><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> according <S%G2596><s%> to the law, <S%G3551><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> command <S%G2753><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> to be struck <S%G5180><s%> contrary to the law? <S%G3891><s%>"
Those <S%G1161><s%> who <S%G3588><s%> stood by <S%G3936><s%> said, <S%G2036><s%> "Do you malign <S%G3058><s%> God <S%G2316><s%>'s high priest? <S%G749><s%>"

<S%G5037><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> said, <S%G5346><s%> "I didn't <S%G3756><s%> know, <S%G1492><s%> brothers, <S%G80><s%> that <S%G3754><s%> he was <S%G2076><s%> high priest. <S%G749><s%> For <S%G1063><s%> it is written, <S%G1125><s%> <S%G2046><s%> 'You shall not <S%G3756><s%> speak <S%G2046><s%> evil <S%G2560><s%> of a ruler <S%G758><s%> of your <S%G4675><s%> people. <S%G2992><s%>'"

But <S%G1161><s%> when Paul <S%G3972><s%> perceived <S%G1097><s%> that <S%G3754><s%> the one <S%G1520><s%> part <S%G3313><s%> were <S%G2076><s%> Sadducees <S%G4523><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> the other <S%G2087><s%> Pharisees, <S%G5330><s%> he cried out <S%G2896><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the council, <S%G4892><s%> "Men <S%G435><s%> and brothers, <S%G80><s%> I <S%G1473><s%> am <S%G1510><s%> a Pharisee, <S%G5330><s%> a son <S%G5207><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> Pharisees. <S%G5330><s%> Concerning the hope <S%G1680><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> resurrection <S%G386><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> the dead <S%G3498><s%> I am being judged! <S%G1473><s%>"

<S%G1161><s%> When <S%G5124><s%> he <S%G846><s%> had said <S%G2980><s%> this, <S%G4714><s%> an argument arose <S%G1096><s%> between the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Sadducees, <S%G4523><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> the assembly <S%G4128><s%> was divided. <S%G4977><s%>

For <S%G1063><s%> the Sadducees <S%G4523><s%> <S%G99999><s%> say that <S%G3004><s%> there is <S%G1511><s%> no <S%G3361><s%> resurrection, <S%G386><s%> nor <S%G3383><s%> angel, <S%G32><s%> nor <S%G3383><s%> spirit; <S%G4151><s%> but <S%G1161><s%> the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> confess <S%G3670><s%> all of these. <S%G297><s%>

A <S%G1161><s%> great <S%G3173><s%> clamor arose, <S%G1096><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> some of the scribes <S%G1122><s%> of the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> part <S%G3313><s%> stood up, <S%G450><s%> and contended, <S%G1264><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "We find <S%G2147><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> evil <S%G2556><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> this <S%G5129><s%> man. <S%G444><s%> But <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> a spirit <S%G4151><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> angel <S%G32><s%> has spoken <S%G2980><s%> to him, <S%G846><s%> let <S%G2313><s%>'s not <S%G3361><s%> fight against God! <S%G2313><s%>"

When <S%G1161><s%> a great <S%G4183><s%> argument <S%G4714><s%> arose, <S%G1096><s%> the commanding officer, <S%G5506><s%> fearing <S%G2125><s%> that <S%G3361><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> would be torn in pieces <S%G1288><s%> by <S%G5259><s%> them, <S%G846><s%> commanded <S%G2753><s%> the soldiers <S%G4753><s%> to go down <S%G2597><s%> and take <S%G726><s%> him <S%G846><s%> by force <S%G726><s%> from <S%G1537><s%> among <S%G3319><s%> them, <S%G846><s%> and <S%G5037><s%> bring <S%G71><s%> him into <S%G1519><s%> the barracks. <S%G3925><s%>

The <S%G1161><s%> following <S%G1966><s%> night, <S%G3571><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> stood <S%G2186><s%> by him, <S%G846><s%> and said, <S%G2036><s%> "Cheer <S%G2293><s%> up, <S%G3972><s%> Paul, for <S%G1063><s%> as <S%G5613><s%> you have testified <S%G1263><s%> about <S%G4012><s%> me <S%G1700><s%> at <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem, <S%G2419><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> you <S%G4571><s%> must <S%G1163><s%> testify <S%G3140><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> at <S%G1519><s%> Rome. <S%G4516><s%>"

When <S%G1161><s%> it was <S%G1096><s%> day, <S%G2250><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> banded <S%G4160><s%> together, <S%G4963><s%> and bound <S%G332><s%> themselves <S%G1438><s%> under a curse, <S%G332><s%> saying that <S%G3004><s%> they would <S%G5315><s%> neither <S%G3383><s%> eat <S%G5315><s%> nor <S%G3383><s%> drink <S%G4095><s%> until <S%G2193><s%> they <S%G3739><s%> had killed <S%G615><s%> Paul. <S%G3972><s%>
<S%G1161><s%> There were <S%G2258><s%> more <S%G4119><s%> than forty <S%G5062><s%> people who <S%G3588><s%> had made <S%G4160><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> conspiracy. <S%G4945><s%>

They <S%G3748><s%> came <S%G4334><s%> to the chief priests <S%G749><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> the elders, <S%G4245><s%> and said, <S%G2036><s%> "We have bound <S%G332><s%> ourselves <S%G1438><s%> under a <S%G3739><s%> great curse, <S%G331><s%> to taste <S%G1089><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> until <S%G2193><s%> we have killed <S%G615><s%> Paul. <S%G3972><s%>

Now <S%G3568><s%> therefore, <S%G3767><s%> you <S%G5210><s%> with <S%G4862><s%> the council <S%G4892><s%> inform <S%G1718><s%> the commanding officer <S%G5506><s%> that <S%G3704><s%> he should bring <S%G2609><s%> him <S%G846><s%> down <S%G2609><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> you <S%G5209><s%> tomorrow, <S%G839><s%> as though <S%G5613><s%> you <S%G5209><s%> were going to judge <S%G1231><s%> his <S%G846><s%> case <S%G4012><s%> more exactly. <S%G199><s%> <S%G1161><s%> We <S%G2249><s%> are <S%G2070><s%> ready <S%G2092><s%> to kill <S%G337><s%> him <S%G846><s%> before <S%G4253><s%> he <S%G846><s%> comes near. <S%G1448><s%>"

But <S%G1161><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%>'s sister <S%G79><s%>'s son <S%G5207><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> of their lying in wait, <S%G1749><s%> and he came <S%G3854><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> entered <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the barracks <S%G3925><s%> and told <S%G518><s%> Paul. <S%G3972><s%>

<S%G1161><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> summoned <S%G4341><s%> one <S%G1520><s%> of the centurions, <S%G1543><s%> and said, <S%G5346><s%> "Bring <S%G520><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> young man <S%G3494><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> the commanding officer, <S%G5506><s%> for <S%G1063><s%> he has <S%G2192><s%> something <S%G5100><s%> to tell <S%G518><s%> him. <S%G846><s%>"

So <S%G3767><s%> <S%G99999><s%> he took <S%G3880><s%> him, <S%G846><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> brought <S%G71><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> the commanding officer, <S%G2532><s%> and said, <S%G5346><s%> "Paul, <S%G3972><s%> the prisoner, <S%G1198><s%> summoned <S%G4341><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> and asked me <S%G2065><s%> to bring <S%G71><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> young man <S%G3494><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> you, <S%G4571><s%> who has <S%G2192><s%> something <S%G5100><s%> to tell <S%G2980><s%> you. <S%G4671><s%>"

The <S%G1161><s%> commanding officer <S%G5506><s%> took <S%G1949><s%> him <S%G846><s%> by the hand, <S%G5495><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> going <S%G402><s%> aside, <S%G2596><s%> asked <S%G4441><s%> him privately, <S%G2398><s%> "What <S%G5101><s%> is <S%G2076><s%> it that <S%G3739><s%> you have <S%G2192><s%> to tell <S%G518><s%> me? <S%G3427><s%>"

<S%G1161><s%> He said, <S%G3754><s%> "The Jews <S%G2453><s%> have agreed <S%G4934><s%> to ask <S%G2065><s%> you <S%G4571><s%> to <S%G3704><s%> bring Paul <S%G3972><s%> down <S%G2609><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> the council <S%G4892><s%> tomorrow, <S%G839><s%> as though <S%G5613><s%> intending to inquire <S%G4441><s%> somewhat <S%G5100><s%> more <S%G3195><s%> accurately <S%G199><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> him. <S%G846><s%>

Therefore <S%G3767><s%> <S%G3982><s%> don't <S%G3361><s%> <S%G4771><s%> yield <S%G3982><s%> to them, <S%G846><s%> for <S%G1063><s%> <S%G1537><s%> <S%G846><s%> more <S%G4119><s%> than forty <S%G5062><s%> men <S%G435><s%> lie in wait <S%G1748><s%> for him, <S%G846><s%> who <S%G3748><s%> have bound <S%G332><s%> themselves <S%G1438><s%> under a curse <S%G332><s%> <S%G3739><s%> neither <S%G3383><s%> to <S%G5315><s%> eat <S%G5315><s%> nor <S%G3383><s%> to drink <S%G4095><s%> until <S%G2193><s%> <S%G3739><s%> they <S%G1526><s%> have killed <S%G337><s%> him. <S%G846><s%> <S%G2532><s%> Now <S%G3568><s%> they are ready, <S%G2092><s%> looking for <S%G4327><s%> the promise <S%G1860><s%> from <S%G575><s%> you. <S%G4675><s%>"

So <S%G3767><s%> <S%G99999><s%> the commanding officer <S%G5506><s%> let <S%G630><s%> the young man <S%G3494><s%> go, <S%G630><s%> charging <S%G3853><s%> him, <S%G1583><s%> "Tell no one <S%G3367><s%> that <S%G3754><s%> you have revealed <S%G1718><s%> these things <S%G5023><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> me. <S%G3165><s%>"

<S%G2532><s%> He <S%G5100><s%> called <S%G4341><s%> to himself two <S%G1417><s%> of the centurions, <S%G1543><s%> and said, <S%G2036><s%> "Prepare <S%G2090><s%> two hundred <S%G1250><s%> soldiers <S%G4757><s%> to <S%G3704><s%> go <S%G4198><s%> as far as <S%G2193><s%> Caesarea, <S%G2542><s%> with <S%G2532><s%> seventy <S%G1440><s%> horsemen, <S%G2460><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> two hundred <S%G1250><s%> men armed with spears, <S%G1187><s%> at <S%G575><s%> the third <S%G5154><s%> hour <S%G5610><s%> of the night. <S%G3571><s%>"

He <S%G5037><s%> asked them to provide <S%G3936><s%> animals, <S%G2934><s%> that <S%G2443><s%> they might set <S%G1913><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> on <S%G1913><s%> one, <S%G1295><s%> and bring him safely <S%G1295><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> Felix <S%G5344><s%> the governor. <S%G2232><s%>
He wrote <S%G1125><s%> a letter <S%G1992><s%> like <S%G4023><s%> <S%G5179><s%> this: <S%G5126><s%>
"Claudius <S%G2804><s%> Lysias <S%G3079><s%> to the most excellent <S%G2903><s%> governor <S%G2232><s%> Felix: <S%G5344><s%> Greetings. <S%G5463><s%>

"This <S%G5126><s%> man <S%G435><s%> was seized <S%G4815><s%> by <S%G5259><s%> the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> was about <S%G5259><s%> to be killed <S%G337><s%> by <S%G5259><s%> them, <S%G846><s%> when I <S%G2186><s%> came with <S%G4862><s%> the soldiers <S%G4753><s%> and rescued <S%G1807><s%> him, <S%G846><s%> having learned <S%G3129><s%> that <S%G3754><s%> he was <S%G2076><s%> a Roman. <S%G4514><s%>

<S%G1161><s%> Desiring <S%G1014><s%> to know <S%G1097><s%> the cause <S%G156><s%> <S%G1223><s%> why <S%G3739><s%> they accused <S%G1458><s%> him, <S%G846><s%> I brought <S%G2609><s%> him <S%G846><s%> down <S%G2609><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> their <S%G846><s%> council. <S%G4892><s%>

I found <S%G2147><s%> him <S%G3739><s%> to be accused <S%G1458><s%> about <S%G4012><s%> questions <S%G2213><s%> of their <S%G846><s%> law, <S%G3551><s%> but <S%G1161><s%> not to be <S%G2192><s%> charged <S%G1462><s%> with anything <S%G3367><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of death <S%G2288><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> of imprisonment. <S%G1199><s%>

When <S%G1161><s%> I <S%G3195><s%> was told <S%G3377><s%> <S%G5259><s%> that <S%G2071><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%> <S%G3195><s%> lay in wait <S%G1917><s%> for <S%G1519><s%> the man, <S%G435><s%> I sent <S%G3992><s%> him to <S%G4314><s%> you <S%G4571><s%> immediately, <S%G1824><s%> charging <S%G3853><s%> his accusers <S%G2725><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> to bring their accusations <S%G3004><s%> against <S%G4314><s%> him <S%G846><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> you. <S%G4675><s%> Farewell. <S%G4517><s%>"

So <S%G3767><s%> <S%G99999><s%> the soldiers, <S%G4757><s%> carrying <S%G2596><s%> out their <S%G846><s%> orders, <S%G1299><s%> took <S%G353><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> and brought <S%G71><s%> him by <S%G1223><s%> night <S%G3571><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Antipatris. <S%G494><s%>

But on <S%G1161><s%> the next day <S%G1887><s%> they left <S%G1439><s%> the horsemen <S%G2460><s%> to go <S%G4198><s%> with <S%G4862><s%> him, <S%G846><s%> and returned <S%G5290><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> the barracks. <S%G3925><s%>

When <S%G3748><s%> they came <S%G1525><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Caesarea <S%G2542><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> delivered <S%G325><s%> the letter <S%G1992><s%> to the governor, <S%G2232><s%> they also <S%G2532><s%> presented <S%G3936><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> to him. <S%G846><s%>

<S%G2532><s%> When <S%G1161><s%> the governor <S%G2232><s%> had read <S%G314><s%> it, <S%G1905><s%> he asked <S%G1537><s%> what <S%G4169><s%> province <S%G1885><s%> he was <S%G2076><s%> from. <S%G2532><s%> When he understood <S%G4441><s%> that <S%G3754><s%> he was <S%G2076><s%> from Cilicia, <S%G2791><s%> he said, <S%G5346><s%>

"I will hear <S%G1251><s%> you <S%G4675><s%> fully when <S%G3752><s%> your <S%G4675><s%> accusers <S%G2725><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> arrive. <S%G3854><s%>" <S%G5037><s%> He <S%G5346><s%> commanded <S%G2753><s%> that he <S%G846><s%> be kept <S%G5442><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> Herod <S%G2264><s%>'s palace. <S%G4232><s%>
